revised_title: The Initiation and Thermal Diversity of Granite Magmatism
tldr: This article discusses the initiation and thermal variety of granite magmatism, focusing on the relationship between mantle-derived magmas and the generation of granitic rocks. It explores the role of plate tectonics and the influence of mantle melting on the formation of the Earth's continental crust. The authors argue that the majority of modern granites are found in Cordilleran settings, and that the balance between marginal heat focusing and intracontinental granite generation has shifted over time.
